intro: Alluaudia decaryi, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a unique succulent native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its branching, spiny stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, round fruits. Its leaves are typically small, fleshy, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Alluaudia decaryi is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water.
